docs.snippet: English football is "too honest" for its own good at times and might do better in future if it plays with a more "streetwise, nasty" attitude that other teams employ, according to striker Wayne Rooney.
docs.lead_paragraph: English football is "too honest" for its own good at times and might do better in future if it plays with a more "streetwise, nasty" attitude that other teams employ, according to striker Wayne Rooney.

headline.main: England Needs to Get a Little Bit More Nasty Says Rooney
headline.print_headline: England Needs to Get a Little Bit More Nasty Says Rooney

docs.snippet: FIFA has picked Marco Rodriquez of Mexico to referee the Italy vs. Uruguay game that will decide which team advances from Group D with Costa Rica.
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA has picked Marco Rodriquez of Mexico to referee the Italy vs. Uruguay game that will decide which team advances from Group D with Costa Rica.

docs.snippet: When the World Cup draw was made, Costa Rica was considered a rank outsider to advance to the World Cup knockout phase. Now, the Central American country is dreaming about winning Group D when it faces England on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: When the World Cup draw was made, Costa Rica was considered a rank outsider to advance to the World Cup knockout phase. Now, the Central American country is dreaming about winning Group D when it faces England on Tuesday.

headline.main: Costa Rica Dreams of Winning World Cup Group
headline.print_headline: Costa Rica Dreams of Winning World Cup Group

docs.snippet: Luis Suarez and Uruguay are full of momentum after beating England.
docs.lead_paragraph: Luis Suarez and Uruguay are full of momentum after beating England.

headline.main: 'In or Out': Italy and Uruguay Battle to Advance
headline.print_headline: 'In or Out': Italy and Uruguay Battle to Advance

docs.snippet: It will be nothing new for Italy captain Gianluigi Buffon when the Azzurri face Uruguay on Tuesday with a spot in the second round of the World Cup on the line.
docs.lead_paragraph: It will be nothing new for Italy captain Gianluigi Buffon when the Azzurri face Uruguay on Tuesday with a spot in the second round of the World Cup on the line.

headline.main: 'Do or Die' Matches Are Nothing New for Buffon
headline.print_headline: 'Do or Die' Matches Are Nothing New for Buffon

docs.snippet: Costa Rica play England in their final World Cup Group D match in Belo Horizonte on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Costa Rica play England in their final World Cup Group D match in Belo Horizonte on Tuesday.

docs.snippet: England's wounded 'Three Lions' play for pride only in their final World Cup game on Tuesday against Costa Rica who want another scalp to seal top spot in Group D after shocking Uruguay and Italy.
docs.lead_paragraph: England's wounded 'Three Lions' play for pride only in their final World Cup game on Tuesday against Costa Rica who want another scalp to seal top spot in Group D after shocking Uruguay and Italy.

headline.main: England Play for Pride Against Giant-Killing Costa Rica
headline.print_headline: England Play for Pride Against Giant-Killing Costa Rica

docs.snippet: Costa Rica's football federation has sent a letter to FIFA demanding an explanation for why so many of its players were required to submit to anti-doping controls after a surprise victory over Italy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Costa Rica's football federation has sent a letter to FIFA demanding an explanation for why so many of its players were required to submit to anti-doping controls after a surprise victory over Italy.

headline.main: Costa Rica Complains to FIFA About Anti-Doping
headline.print_headline: Costa Rica Complains to FIFA About Anti-Doping

docs.snippet: England captain Steven Gerrard will spend the summer deciding whether to retire from international football after the team's early World Cup elimination.
docs.lead_paragraph: England captain Steven Gerrard will spend the summer deciding whether to retire from international football after the team's early World Cup elimination.

headline.main: Gerrard to Spend Summer Considering England Future
headline.print_headline: Gerrard to Spend Summer Considering England Future

docs.snippet: Captain Steven Gerrard will take his time to decide his international future after he told a news conference on Sunday he was "broken" by England's humiliating exit from the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: Captain Steven Gerrard will take his time to decide his international future after he told a news conference on Sunday he was "broken" by England's humiliating exit from the World Cup.

headline.main: 'Broken' Gerrard Waits to Decide England Future
